content: bowerbird by cath ward male bowerbirds are known for their glossy blue-black plumage and for being the interior decorators of the bird world they build a bower of sticks and decorate it with a collection of brightly coloured blue found objects this crescent shawl is knitted in a 4ply heavy silk lace yarn and includes a feather motif in its border it is knitted from the centre top down to the border in one continuous piece the elements of the shawl are a succession of 8 stitch repeats which flow from the top to the border of the shawl both charted and written instructions are included in this pattern the blocked piece as knitted measured approximately 38cm deep x 200cm around the bottom edge however the final size will vary according to yarn and needle choices bowerbird ©2017 cath
